morning.description: Explore this magnificent Mughal-era tomb, a precursor to the Taj Mahal. Arrive early to avoid the peak heat.

afternoon.description: Experience the diverse cultures of India at Dilli Haat. Shop for handicrafts, textiles, and enjoy regional cuisine in a sheltered environment.

evening.description: Enjoy a delicious Mughlai dinner at Karim's, a legendary restaurant known for its non-vegetarian dishes. Consider ordering takeaway or dining in an air-conditioned area due to the heat.

morning.description: Discover India's rich history and art at the National Museum, a large, air-conditioned museum with diverse collections.

afternoon.description: Enjoy some retail therapy in the air-conditioned comfort of Select Citywalk, a large shopping mall with a variety of brands and restaurants.

evening.activity: Dinner at Indian Accent (Optional, requires booking)
evening.description: If budget allows and you're interested in fine dining, try Indian Accent for a modern take on Indian cuisine. Booking in advance is essential. Alternatively, explore restaurants in Connaught Place.
evening.estimated_cost: Rs. 5000-8000 (Indian Accent, per person) or Rs. 2000-3000 (Connaught Place)

budget_hotels: The Bloomrooms @ New Delhi Railway Station
airbnb: Search for options in areas like Hauz Khas, Defence Colony, or Greater Kailash for a range of price points.

weather_suggestion: Due to the extremely hot weather in Delhi during May, prioritize indoor activities and stay hydrated. Limit outdoor exposure to the early morning or late evening hours. Seek out air-conditioned spaces whenever possible.
transportation: Use ride-sharing apps like Uber or Ola for convenient transportation. Delhi also has a metro system, which can be a cost-effective way to travel between locations. Auto-rickshaws are available, but negotiate the fare beforehand.
local_events: Check local listings closer to your travel dates for any specific events or festivals happening during your visit. However, expect fewer outdoor events due to the heat.
